card.description: It’s dusk, the softened hour. Two girls, absorbed,/ light paper lanterns, hems of frocks awash/ in grass, in unkempt strews and sweeps of green./ Sargent’s skilled touch swims through the strokes and dots/ each hog’s hair brush, each squirrel tip, could paint. (poem by Eric Forsbergh)

group.description:
This group embraces the traditionalism of those pioneers of the 1940s, 1950s, and 1960s known as the New Conservatives. The New Conservatives were a loose group of conservative academics and scholars who after the crisis of World War II revived interest in Western civilization and American cultural renewal. The New Conservatives also brought about a renaissance in the study of the life and work of Anglo-Irish statesman and philosopher Edmund Burke. Their immediate forebears included the New Humanists, the Distributists, T. S. Eliot, Ralph Adams Cram, C. S. Lewis, Herbert Agar, Bernard Iddings Bell, Christopher Dawson, and the Southern Agrarians.
Articles:
"Understanding Traditionalist Conservatism" by Mark C. Henrie
http://www.newpantagruel.com/

"The Founding of the 20th Century Conservative Movement: The Restoration of Traditionalism." by Fred Hutchison
https://web.archive.org/web/20130228220356/http://www.renewamerica.com/columns/hutchison/080317

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Traditionalist_Conservatism

card.description: Has the drive for equality trapped the West in a cycle of fervor, terror, and disillusionment?
card.title: The Modernity Loop

_source.content: "As part of my fellowship in Budapest, I had a conversation with a Dutch sociologist named Eric Hendricks-Kim, who suggested that, since the French Revolution, the West has been trapped in a cycle of fervor, terror, and disillusionment—or what might be called the “modernity loop.” In this theory, Western societies have relentlessly pursued equality, only to be disappointed when these social movements collapse into chaos. Is the woke revolution part of this pattern? And can Western societies escape the loop?"https://rufo.substack.com/p/the-modernity-loop?utm_source=post-email-title&publication_id=1248321&post_id=111482007&isFreemail=true&utm_medium=email

group.description:
This group embraces the traditionalism of those pioneers of the 1940s, 1950s, and 1960s known as the New Conservatives. The New Conservatives were a loose group of conservative academics and scholars who after the crisis of World War II revived interest in Western civilization and American cultural renewal. The New Conservatives also brought about a renaissance in the study of the life and work of Anglo-Irish statesman and philosopher Edmund Burke. Their immediate forebears included the New Humanists, the Distributists, T. S. Eliot, Ralph Adams Cram, C. S. Lewis, Herbert Agar, Bernard Iddings Bell, Christopher Dawson, and the Southern Agrarians.
Articles:
"Understanding Traditionalist Conservatism" by Mark C. Henrie
http://www.newpantagruel.com/

"The Founding of the 20th Century Conservative Movement: The Restoration of Traditionalism." by Fred Hutchison
https://web.archive.org/web/20130228220356/http://www.renewamerica.com/columns/hutchison/080317

En 1981, après des études à HEC, Eric devient spécialiste de l'optimisation fiscale notamment pour Elton John.

En 1990 élu au conseil municipal de Chantilly, son élection est annulée par le conseil détat pour incompatibilité avec sa fonction de directeur général de l’ADO.

A partir de 1993 il devient directeur financier et administratif du RPR.
Il est élu maire de Chantilly en 1995 puis député en 2002.

En 2007 il est chargé de l'association pour financer la campagne de Sarkozy.
Dans le même temps, sa femme devient directrice des investissements de Clymène, holding financière de la milliardaire Liliane Bettencourt.

En 2012 Woerth sera mis en examen pour trafic d'influence passif et recel de financement illicite de parti politique dans l'affaire Affaire Bettencourt.

Il sera relaxé en 2015 au motif qu’il n’avait connaissance «de la particulière vulnérabilité de Liliane Bettencourt»

En 2018, nouvelle mise en examen pour « complicité de financement illégal de campagne électorale ». Il reconnaitra avoir distribué plusieurs dizaines de milliers d'euros d'argent liquide d’origine anonyme à des salariés de la campagne de Sarkozy en 2017.

En 2021, il est mis en examen pour malversations dans l'affaire Tapie.
Éric Woerth ministre du budget avait permis au groupe Tapie de ne payer que 43 millions d’euros de taxes au lieu de 101 millions.

Il est relaxé en 2022, infraction pas suffisamment caractérisée.

_source.content: Good morning everyone and Happy Storytime Sunday! In the summer of '86, the year after I graduated high school, I was ready to move out from my parents' home. I was looking to rent a basic, cheap, efficiency apartment, but my friend Eric found something better. There was a 3 bedroom ranch for $750 a month that was located about a half mile away from the T.G.I. Friday's I was working at. It was easily affordable for the 2 of us to split the rent, and way nicer than any of the apartments I looked at. One of the most fun features of the property was the "shed." You're all probably familiar with the large shipping containers that come in off the big cargo ships. Well the owner/landlord had one of those secured onto a bed of concrete, and ran wires from the house to the shed, so it had electricity (there were 3 electric outlets in there). Since I was a self-taught drummer and Eric played guitar, our first thought was that this would be perfect for jamming. Of course, because the walls were so thin, sound would carry, and we'd be disturbing the neighbors every time we played. However, the advantage of working at a restaurant was that I could take as many of the egg flats as I wanted (Friday's got in cases of eggs, separated by them so they wouldn't break during shipping). It took me a few months to acquire enough of them layer them all over the walls and ceiling so they were thick enough to dampen the noise. By the time we did that and laid down all the carpeting, the sound of our playing was muffled enough that it could only be heard if you were standing in the back yard. My fellow line cook and friend Larry played bass guitar and could sing a little bit, so now we had a garage band which we aptly named "Electric Shed." We weren't very good, but we could play loud and have fun. Just for kicks, we entered a local "Battle Of The Bands" contest in the summer of '88. We lost badly in the first round, and that was that for public appearances. 😂 However, we had some epic parties and lots of great times until time marched on, and so did we. These happy memories made me think of this happy little tune today. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tsf7m_DETxE

Well the owner/landlord had one of those secured onto a bed of concrete, and ran wires from the house to the shed, so it had electricity (there were 3 electric outlets in there). Since I was a self-taught drummer and Eric played guitar, our first thought was that this would be perfect for jamming. Of course, because the walls were so thin, sound would carry, and we'd be disturbing the neighbors every time we played. However, the advantage of working at a restaurant was that I could take as many of the egg flats as I wanted (Friday's got in cases of eggs, separated by them so they wouldn't break during shipping). It took me a few months to acquire enough of them layer them all over the walls and ceiling so they were thick enough to dampen the noise. By the time we did that and laid down all the carpeting, the sound of our playing was muffled enough that it could only be heard if you were standing in the back yard.
My fellow line cook and friend Larry played bass guitar and could sing a little bit, so now we had a garage band which we aptly named "Electric Shed." card.title: Investigation Reveals 'Revolving Door' Of DOJ, Big Tech Employees

_source.content: Investigation Reveals 'Revolving Door' Of DOJ, Big Tech EmployeesIn the midst of an ongoing lawsuit against the Biden administration alleging collaboration with social media companies to censor Americans, a new report has detailed the extent to which former Justice Department (DOJ) employees are now working at “Big Tech” firms.The logos of Big Tech companies Amazon, Apple, Facebook, and Google, in file photos. The American Accountability Foundation (AAF) investigated the resumes of recent hires and found that more than 360 current employees of Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Apple, and Facebook/Meta are former DOJ employees. Likewise, more than 40 DOJ employees, many of them in senior roles, previously worked at Big Tech firms.According to the report, since President Joe Biden took office, Google hired 40 former DOJ staffers, Amazon hired 61, Microsoft hired 26, and Meta hired 53.While staff often move between government and the private sector, “this case is different because unlike government and industry moving expertise back and forth (knowledge about procurement rules for example) what we have seen moving back and forth between DOJ and tech is a shared political agenda, specifically to silence conservative voices,” Yitz Friedman, AAF communications manager, told The Epoch Times.“Sadly, it is evidence that in the Big Tech community, corporate policy is the government’s policy.”This concern is heightened by recent evidence of collaboration between the DOJ and Twitter to silence Americans, particularly regarding political speech.After buying social media platform Twitter, Elon Musk released thousands of internal emails that allegedly showed collusion between Twitter and DOJ officials to censor speech, including banning a report by the New York Post before the 2020 election that reportedly incriminated then-candidate Joe Biden in illicit payments scandals.‘Campaign of Public Threats’The release of the “Twitter files” follows a lawsuit by Louisiana Attorney General Jeff Landry and former Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt that alleges illegal collusion between the Biden administration and Big Tech companies to suppress free speech.In a November 2022 interview with The Epoch Times, Landry stated that, because of the First Amendment, “the government doesn’t have the ability to censor speech, especially political speech. And so they can’t go out there and force these companies [to do it].”Plaintiffs in this case filed a 364-page “finding of fact” document showing a “campaign of public threats against social-media platforms to pressure them to censor more speech on social media.” This document will be discussed in a congressional hearing on March 30 on the “Weaponization of the Federal Government.”https://www.zerohedge.com/political/investigation-reveals-revolving-door-doj-big-tech-employees
_source.contentraw:
Investigation Reveals 'Revolving Door' Of DOJ, Big Tech Employees
In the midst of an ongoing lawsuit against the Biden administration alleging collaboration with social media companies to censor Americans, a new report has detailed the extent to which former Justice Department (DOJ) employees are now working at “Big Tech” firms.
The logos of Big Tech companies Amazon, Apple, Facebook, and Google, in file photos.
The American Accountability Foundation (AAF) investigated the resumes of recent hires and found that more than 360 current employees of Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Apple, and Facebook/Meta are former DOJ employees. Likewise, more than 40 DOJ employees, many of them in senior roles, previously worked at Big Tech firms.
According to the report, since President Joe Biden took office, Google hired 40 former DOJ staffers, Amazon hired 61, Microsoft hired 26, and Meta hired 53.
While staff often move between government and the private sector, “this case is different because unlike government and industry moving expertise back and forth (knowledge about procurement rules for example) what we have seen moving back and forth between DOJ and tech is a shared political agenda, specifically to silence conservative voices,” Yitz Friedman, AAF communications manager, told The Epoch Times.
“Sadly, it is evidence that in the Big Tech community, corporate policy is the government’s policy.”
This concern is heightened by recent evidence of collaboration between the DOJ and Twitter to silence Americans, particularly regarding political speech.
After buying social media platform Twitter, Elon Musk released thousands of internal emails that allegedly showed collusion between Twitter and DOJ officials to censor speech, including banning a report by the New York Post before the 2020 election that reportedly incriminated then-candidate Joe Biden in illicit payments scandals.
‘Campaign of Public Threats’
The release of the “Twitter files” follows a lawsuit by Louisiana Attorney General Jeff Landry and former Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt that alleges illegal collusion between the Biden administration and Big Tech companies to suppress free speech.
In a November 2022 interview with The Epoch Times, Landry stated that, because of the First Amendment, “the government doesn’t have the ability to censor speech, especially political speech. And so they can’t go out there and force these companies [to do it].”
Plaintiffs in this case filed a 364-page “finding of fact” document showing a “campaign of public threats against social-media platforms to pressure them to censor more speech on social media.” This document will be discussed in a congressional hearing on March 30 on the “Weaponization of the Federal Government.”
https://www.zerohedge.com/political/investigation-reveals-revolving-door-doj-big-tech-employees

card.description: As the U.S. government, tech companies, the media and urban developers double down on the idea that future cities must be “smart,” critics warn the technology-driven urban projects will turn cities into “data farms.”
card.title: Critics Warn of ‘a Dragnet of Surveillance’ as U.S. Pushes Ahead With Plans for More ‘Smart’ Cities

_source.content: U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg last week announced $94 million in grant awards to fund 59 smart city technology projects across the country.Despite widespread and mounting pushback against biometric surveillance and control systems associated with smart city technologies and the failure of the U.S. Department of Transportation’s (DOT) previous attempt to grant-fund smart city transformation in Columbus, Ohio, Buttigieg told The Verge he thinks “smart city technologies matter more than ever.”Cities just need to take a different approach — experimenting with and testing out different technologies first, rather than implementing a “grand unified system” all at once, Buttigieg said.The new grants, part of the Strengthening Mobility and Revolutionizing Transportation (SMART) Grants Program, are the first round of $500 million in funding that will be awarded for smaller smart mobility projects over the next five years, authorized under the 2021 Bipartisan Infrastructure Law.In this funding round, DOT awarded smart grants for a range of projects, including drone surveillance or delivery, smart traffic signals, connected vehicles, autonomous vehicles, smart grid development, intelligent sensors and other Internet of Things (IoT) infrastructure. Some cities, including Los Angeles (LA), received multiple grants.Smart city development typically focuses on the implementation of technologies like the IoT, 5G, cloud and edge computing, and biometric surveillance to track, manage, control and extract profit from an array of urban processes.Whitney Webb, an investigative journalist and smart cities critic, said the smart city infrastructure is meant to facilitate the development of cities “micromanaged by technocrats via an all-encompassing system of mass surveillance and a vast array of ‘internet of things’ devices that provide a constant and massive stream of data that is analyzed by artificial intelligence (AI).”‘Concept of a sensor in every home doesn’t look as shiny as it once did’Smart city projects began gaining traction in the U.S. in 2015, boosted by a program launched by then-DOT Secretary Anthony Foxx. Foxx, who went on to become the chief policy officer for Lyft, now works at Tulco, a data science venture capital firm. Foxx created the “Smart City Challenge,” which offered a $50 million grant to the mid-sized city with the best proposal to remake their city as a “smart city.”Vulcan LLC, an investment and philanthropic organization dedicated to materializing the vision of Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen and whose profit-making services focus on real estate development, partly funded the federal grant.Columbus, Ohio, beat out 77 other cities with its “revolutionary” proposal, but the project was by most accounts a failure — expensive trip-planning kiosks erected downtown were never used, autonomous shuttles had accidents, the public transportation platform was rarely downloaded and sensor-connected trucks failed to materialize.Then, in May 2020, another paradigmatic smart city model project failed when Google smart city subsidiary Sidewalk Labs scrapped plans to build a smart city prototype in Toronto amid public outcry about surveillance and profiteering.According to The Globe and Mail, Eric Schmidt, former head of Google parent company Alphabet, described the project in these terms:“The genesis of the thinking for Sidewalk Labs came from Google’s founders getting excited thinking of ‘all the things you could do if someone would just give us a city and put us in charge.’”https://childrenshealthdefense.org/defender/smart-cities-surveillance-tech/
_source.contentraw:
U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg last week announced $94 million in grant awards to fund 59 smart city technology projects across the country.

Despite widespread and mounting pushback against biometric surveillance and control systems associated with smart city technologies and the failure of the U.S. Department of Transportation’s (DOT) previous attempt to grant-fund smart city transformation in Columbus, Ohio, Buttigieg told The Verge he thinks “smart city technologies matter more than ever.”

Cities just need to take a different approach — experimenting with and testing out different technologies first, rather than implementing a “grand unified system” all at once, Buttigieg said.

The new grants, part of the Strengthening Mobility and Revolutionizing Transportation (SMART) Grants Program, are the first round of $500 million in funding that will be awarded for smaller smart mobility projects over the next five years, authorized under the 2021 Bipartisan Infrastructure Law.

In this funding round, DOT awarded smart grants for a range of projects, including drone surveillance or delivery, smart traffic signals, connected vehicles, autonomous vehicles, smart grid development, intelligent sensors and other Internet of Things (IoT) infrastructure. Some cities, including Los Angeles (LA), received multiple grants.

Smart city development typically focuses on the implementation of technologies like the IoT, 5G, cloud and edge computing, and biometric surveillance to track, manage, control and extract profit from an array of urban processes.

Whitney Webb, an investigative journalist and smart cities critic, said the smart city infrastructure is meant to facilitate the development of cities “micromanaged by technocrats via an all-encompassing system of mass surveillance and a vast array of ‘internet of things’ devices that provide a constant and massive stream of data that is analyzed by artificial intelligence (AI).”

‘Concept of a sensor in every home doesn’t look as shiny as it once did’

Smart city projects began gaining traction in the U.S. in 2015, boosted by a program launched by then-DOT Secretary Anthony Foxx. Foxx, who went on to become the chief policy officer for Lyft, now works at Tulco, a data science venture capital firm. Foxx created the “Smart City Challenge,” which offered a $50 million grant to the mid-sized city with the best proposal to remake their city as a “smart city.”

Vulcan LLC, an investment and philanthropic organization dedicated to materializing the vision of Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen and whose profit-making services focus on real estate development, partly funded the federal grant.

Columbus, Ohio, beat out 77 other cities with its “revolutionary” proposal, but the project was by most accounts a failure — expensive trip-planning kiosks erected downtown were never used, autonomous shuttles had accidents, the public transportation platform was rarely downloaded and sensor-connected trucks failed to materialize.

Then, in May 2020, another paradigmatic smart city model project failed when Google smart city subsidiary Sidewalk Labs scrapped plans to build a smart city prototype in Toronto amid public outcry about surveillance and profiteering.

According to The Globe and Mail, Eric Schmidt, former head of Google parent company Alphabet, described the project in these terms:

“The genesis of the thinking for Sidewalk Labs came from Google’s founders getting excited thinking of ‘all the things you could do if someone would just give us a city and put us in charge.’”

@BreckWorshamOfficial Part 2 Trump in the Network Finkelstein Lauder Network
PAUL MANAFORT
Longtime friend of Roger Stone and Donald Trump.
Partner in BMSK and Mercury lobbying firm.
Charged with obstruction of justice and conspiracy to obstruct justice.
He was Trump’s campaign Chairman early on.
Misled authorities about his lobbying work for Ukrainian politicians.
Introduced to Ukrainian oligarchs thru Finkelstein.
Lobbied for pro-Putin oligarchs like Oleg Derispaska and former Ukrainian President Viktor Yanokovych.
While he was Trump’s campaign chairman, Manafort met with Konstantin Kilimnik, who is believed to be linked to Russian intelligence. The filing says Manafort gave him polling data related to the 2016 campaign and discussed a Ukrainian peace plan with him. Most of the polling data was reportedly public, although some was private Trump campaign polling data. Manafort asked Kilimnik to pass the data to Ukrainians Serhiy Lyovochkin and Rinat Akhmetov.
Convicted on eight charges of tax and bank fraud.
Violated his plea deal by repeatedly lying to investigators. As a result he was sentence 47 months in prison.
Then given an additional 43 months in relation to crimes he wasn’t initially convicted of but guilty of and this resulted in New York state prosecutors charging Manafort with sixteen state felonies.
Pardoned by Donald Trump.
DONALD TRUMP
Longtime friend/associate of Ronald Lauder, Arthur Finkelstein, Roger Stone, Paul Manafort .
Protege of Roy Cohn.
Hired Roger Stone as a key strategist for his campaign.
Hired Paul Manafort as campaign Chairman.
Hired Lewandoski as campaign manager.
His name appeared on Netanyahu’s potential donors list from his 1996 campaign. The two are close.
Allegedly used Gorka as a conduit and a propagandist throughout his campaign resulting in Gorka being appointed a WH role for a period.
Over ruled McMaster on the Cohen-Watnick firingPro-Israel/Netanyahu and pro-Putin.
Kremlin news outlets and pro-Putin alt-right shills promoted Trump.
Robert Mueller indicted Russian operatives including people associated with Internet Research Agency based in St. Petersburg which assisted Trump’ with online propaganda and disinformation.
BENJAMIN NETANYAHU
Israel’s long term 2-time Prime Minister and former finance minister.
Finkelstein masterminded his 1996 campaign for PM
Birnbaum served as an advisor and Chief of Staff
Close to Putin, Trump and Orbán.
Involved in scandal involving Ron Lauder and Jerusalem One.
Very happy with Trump as US President and all he is doing for Israel.
Trump is moving the US Israeli embassy and Trump is having a settlement in Golan Heights name after him.
Linked to major US Zionist billionaires including Lauder, Adelson and several Russian Jewish billionaires including Mikhail Fridman, Len Blavatnik, Roman Abramovich and Tamir Sapir.
GEORGE BIRNBAUM
Dual Israeli that moved to Israel to serve as aide to Benjamin Netanyahu and his chief of staff.
Adviser to Viktor Orbán in 2008
Writes op-eds with Ronn Torossian published on David Horowitz’s Front Page Mag and http://JewishPress.com pushing pro-Likud talking points and attacking their enemies.
Partner in Avenue Strategies taking Corey Lewandowski’s position.
Avenue Strategies were working for Ukrainian opposition leader Yulia Tymoshenko.
COREY LEWANDOWSKI
He was Trump’s campaign manager early on.
He started Avenue Strategies lobbying firm which he peddled access to Trump through.
Represented Citgo (Venezuelan petroleum giant PDVSA have a 49.9% stake. PDVSA took out a loan with Rosneft with their stake in Citgo used as collateral.
He advised PDVSA to contribute $0.5m to Trump’s Inauguration to help get sanctions lifted on Venezuela, which happened.
He quit his position after he brought bad light on the firm and Birnbaum is his ‘under the radar’ replacement at Avenue Strategies
RONN TOROSSIAN
Writes Likud propaganda op-eds with George Birnbaum that attack enemies of Likud like J Street and NIF.
The op-eds are published on David Horowitz’s FrontPage Magand http://JewishPress.com
His PR Firm 5WPR is reported to have business dealings with shady Jewish and Russian oligarchs
In a op-ed for Bulldog Reporter, a PR news site, he ‘saluted Ketchum for their brilliant placing’ of a ‘article by Putin in New York Times.’
He has also claimed that ‘Putin is a genius’ and ‘King of media’Russia and Israel linked Trump associate Felix Sater is one of his clients.
Other clients include Eric Trump, Michael Flynn and Turkey’s government.
Has been pictured with pro-Trump alternative media shills of this network including Laura Loomer.

_source.content: 👇👇Critics Warn of ‘a Dragnet of Surveillance’ as U.S. Pushes Ahead With Plans for More ‘Smart’ CitiesAs the U.S. government, tech companies, the media and urban developers double down on the idea that future cities must be “smart,” critics warn the technology-driven urban projects will turn cities into “data farms.”U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg last week announced $94 million in grant awards to fund 59 smart city technology projects across the country.Despite widespread and mounting pushback against biometric surveillance and control systems associated with smart city technologies and the failure of the U.S. Department of Transportation’s (DOT) previous attempt to grant-fund smart city transformation in Columbus, Ohio, Buttigieg told The Verge he thinks “smart city technologies matter more than ever.”Cities just need to take a different approach — experimenting with and testing out different technologies first, rather than implementing a “grand unified system” all at once, Buttigieg said.The new grants, part of the Strengthening Mobility and Revolutionizing Transportation (SMART) Grants Program, are the first round of $500 million in funding that will be awarded for smaller smart mobility projects over the next five years, authorized under the 2021 Bipartisan Infrastructure Law.In this funding round, DOT awarded smart grants for a range of projects, including drone surveillance or delivery, smart traffic signals, connected vehicles, autonomous vehicles, smart grid development, intelligent sensors and other Internet of Things (IoT) infrastructure. Some cities, including Los Angeles (LA), received multiple grants.Smart city development typically focuses on the implementation of technologies like the IoT, 5G, cloud and edge computing, and biometric surveillance to track, manage, control and extract profit from an array of urban processes.Whitney Webb, an investigative journalist and smart cities critic, said the smart city infrastructure is meant to facilitate the development of cities “micromanaged by technocrats via an all-encompassing system of mass surveillance and a vast array of ‘internet of things’ devices that provide a constant and massive stream of data that is analyzed by artificial intelligence (AI).”‘Concept of a sensor in every home doesn’t look as shiny as it once did’Smart city projects began gaining traction in the U.S. in 2015, boosted by a program launched by then-DOT Secretary Anthony Foxx. Foxx, who went on to become the chief policy officer for Lyft, now works at Tulco, a data science venture capital firm. Foxx created the “Smart City Challenge,” which offered a $50 million grant to the mid-sized city with the best proposal to remake their city as a “smart city.”Vulcan LLC, an investment and philanthropic organization dedicated to materializing the vision of Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen and whose profit-making services focus on real estate development, partly funded the federal grant.Columbus, Ohio, beat out 77 other cities with its “revolutionary” proposal, but the project was by most accounts a failure — expensive trip-planning kiosks erected downtown were never used, autonomous shuttles had accidents, the public transportation platform was rarely downloaded and sensor-connected trucks failed to materialize.Then, in May 2020, another paradigmatic smart city model project failed when Google smart city subsidiary Sidewalk Labs scrapped plans to build a smart city prototype in Toronto amid public outcry about surveillance and profiteering.According to The Globe and Mail, Eric Schmidt, former head of Google parent company Alphabet, described the project in these terms:“The genesis of the thinking for Sidewalk Labs came from Google’s founders getting excited thinking of ‘all the things you could do if someone would just give us a city and put us in charge.’”Visions like these raised a lot of flags among both experts and the general public.Even one of the smart city concept’s biggest promoters, Wired Magazine, admitted that skepticism about smart cities had grown:“Today, as citizens think more carefully about tech-enabled surveillance, the concept of a sensor in every home doesn’t look as shiny as it once did.”San Francisco banned government use of facial recognition software. And Amazon is facing a class action lawsuit in New York City for failing to comply with the city’s law that businesses must inform customers if they are harvesting their biometric data.New York is one of several cities that have passed biometric laws. Several states, including Texas, Washington and Illinois also passed similar laws, Nick Corbishly reported in Naked Capitalism.continuedhttps://childrenshealthdefense.org/defender/smart-cities-surveillance-tech/

👇👇
Critics Warn of ‘a Dragnet of Surveillance’ as U.S. Pushes Ahead With Plans for More ‘Smart’ Cities
As the U.S. government, tech companies, the media and urban developers double down on the idea that future cities must be “smart,” critics warn the technology-driven urban projects will turn cities into “data farms.”
U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg last week announced $94 million in grant awards to fund 59 smart city technology projects across the country.
Despite widespread and mounting pushback against biometric surveillance and control systems associated with smart city technologies and the failure of the U.S. Department of Transportation’s (DOT) previous attempt to grant-fund smart city transformation in Columbus, Ohio, Buttigieg told The Verge he thinks “smart city technologies matter more than ever.”
Cities just need to take a different approach — experimenting with and testing out different technologies first, rather than implementing a “grand unified system” all at once, Buttigieg said.
The new grants, part of the Strengthening Mobility and Revolutionizing Transportation (SMART) Grants Program, are the first round of $500 million in funding that will be awarded for smaller smart mobility projects over the next five years, authorized under the 2021 Bipartisan Infrastructure Law.
In this funding round, DOT awarded smart grants for a range of projects, including drone surveillance or delivery, smart traffic signals, connected vehicles, autonomous vehicles, smart grid development, intelligent sensors and other Internet of Things (IoT) infrastructure. Some cities, including Los Angeles (LA), received multiple grants.
Smart city development typically focuses on the implementation of technologies like the IoT, 5G, cloud and edge computing, and biometric surveillance to track, manage, control and extract profit from an array of urban processes.
Whitney Webb, an investigative journalist and smart cities critic, said the smart city infrastructure is meant to facilitate the development of cities “micromanaged by technocrats via an all-encompassing system of mass surveillance and a vast array of ‘internet of things’ devices that provide a constant and massive stream of data that is analyzed by artificial intelligence (AI).”
‘Concept of a sensor in every home doesn’t look as shiny as it once did’
Smart city projects began gaining traction in the U.S. in 2015, boosted by a program launched by then-DOT Secretary Anthony Foxx. Foxx, who went on to become the chief policy officer for Lyft, now works at Tulco, a data science venture capital firm. Foxx created the “Smart City Challenge,” which offered a $50 million grant to the mid-sized city with the best proposal to remake their city as a “smart city.”
Vulcan LLC, an investment and philanthropic organization dedicated to materializing the vision of Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen and whose profit-making services focus on real estate development, partly funded the federal grant.
Columbus, Ohio, beat out 77 other cities with its “revolutionary” proposal, but the project was by most accounts a failure — expensive trip-planning kiosks erected downtown were never used, autonomous shuttles had accidents, the public transportation platform was rarely downloaded and sensor-connected trucks failed to materialize.
Then, in May 2020, another paradigmatic smart city model project failed when Google smart city subsidiary Sidewalk Labs scrapped plans to build a smart city prototype in Toronto amid public outcry about surveillance and profiteering.
According to The Globe and Mail, Eric Schmidt, former head of Google parent company Alphabet, described the project in these terms:
“The genesis of the thinking for Sidewalk Labs came from Google’s founders getting excited thinking of ‘all the things you could do if someone would just give us a city and put us in charge.’”
Visions like these raised a lot of flags among both experts and the general public.
Even one of the smart city concept’s biggest promoters, Wired Magazine, admitted that skepticism about smart cities had grown:
“Today, as citizens think more carefully about tech-enabled surveillance, the concept of a sensor in every home doesn’t look as shiny as it once did.”
San Francisco banned government use of facial recognition software. And Amazon is facing a class action lawsuit in New York City for failing to comply with the city’s law that businesses must inform customers if they are harvesting their biometric data.
New York is one of several cities that have passed biometric laws. Several states, including Texas, Washington and Illinois also passed similar laws, Nick Corbishly reported in Naked Capitalism.
continued

And in the other corner is the challenger  Joe "Meatball" Tacopina who learned how to talk from watching Humphrey Bogart movies. That guy should really terrify Trump now more that Alvin Bragg.  Remember his name;  Jack Smith.  Somebody I would want on my ass ever.From a humorous side note;  comedian Desi Lydic brutally mocks MAGA clowns by putting together a parody of Trumpers begging for donations for poor victimized Trump."Is there anything more heartbreaking  than the tears of a conservative?  Every single hour,  all across America's conservative TV networks, another sad Republican cries about Donald Trump's indictment."   "Every hour another conservative cries on TV about Trump's indictment.  Help a conservative through an event that is apparently sadder than a school shooting."Very funny stuff for sure.  Anyone can see her video now on Youtube.Very high possibility on Tuesday the judge overseeing Trump's case in New York will threaten Trump and is lawyers if they attempt more threats of violence to the proscutor's office after Tuesday, that Trump will be in world of trouble.And he may go so far as placing a gag order on Trump and his lawyers for the duration of his case.   Judge Marchan is not a judge that they had better take seriously, or else.😎

@Chapism Part 2 Trump in the Network Finkelstein Lauder Network
PAUL MANAFORT
Longtime friend of Roger Stone and Donald Trump.
Partner in BMSK and Mercury lobbying firm.
Charged with obstruction of justice and conspiracy to obstruct justice.
He was Trump’s campaign Chairman early on.
Misled authorities about his lobbying work for Ukrainian politicians.
Introduced to Ukrainian oligarchs thru Finkelstein.
Lobbied for pro-Putin oligarchs like Oleg Derispaska and former Ukrainian President Viktor Yanokovych.
While he was Trump’s campaign chairman, Manafort met with Konstantin Kilimnik, who is believed to be linked to Russian intelligence. The filing says Manafort gave him polling data related to the 2016 campaign and discussed a Ukrainian peace plan with him. Most of the polling data was reportedly public, although some was private Trump campaign polling data. Manafort asked Kilimnik to pass the data to Ukrainians Serhiy Lyovochkin and Rinat Akhmetov.
Convicted on eight charges of tax and bank fraud.
Violated his plea deal by repeatedly lying to investigators. As a result he was sentence 47 months in prison.
Then given an additional 43 months in relation to crimes he wasn’t initially convicted of but guilty of and this resulted in New York state prosecutors charging Manafort with sixteen state felonies.
Pardoned by Donald Trump.
DONALD TRUMP
Longtime friend/associate of Ronald Lauder, Arthur Finkelstein, Roger Stone, Paul Manafort .
Protege of Roy Cohn.
Hired Roger Stone as a key strategist for his campaign.
Hired Paul Manafort as campaign Chairman.
Hired Lewandoski as campaign manager.
His name appeared on Netanyahu’s potential donors list from his 1996 campaign. The two are close.
Allegedly used Gorka as a conduit and a propagandist throughout his campaign resulting in Gorka being appointed a WH role for a period.
Over ruled McMaster on the Cohen-Watnick firingPro-Israel/Netanyahu and pro-Putin.
Kremlin news outlets and pro-Putin alt-right shills promoted Trump.
Robert Mueller indicted Russian operatives including people associated with Internet Research Agency based in St. Petersburg which assisted Trump’ with online propaganda and disinformation.
BENJAMIN NETANYAHU
Israel’s long term 2-time Prime Minister and former finance minister.
Finkelstein masterminded his 1996 campaign for PM
Birnbaum served as an advisor and Chief of Staff
Close to Putin, Trump and Orbán.
Involved in scandal involving Ron Lauder and Jerusalem One.
Very happy with Trump as US President and all he is doing for Israel.
Trump is moving the US Israeli embassy and Trump is having a settlement in Golan Heights name after him.
Linked to major US Zionist billionaires including Lauder, Adelson and several Russian Jewish billionaires including Mikhail Fridman, Len Blavatnik, Roman Abramovich and Tamir Sapir.
GEORGE BIRNBAUM
Dual Israeli that moved to Israel to serve as aide to Benjamin Netanyahu and his chief of staff.
Adviser to Viktor Orbán in 2008
Writes op-eds with Ronn Torossian published on David Horowitz’s Front Page Mag and http://JewishPress.com pushing pro-Likud talking points and attacking their enemies.
Partner in Avenue Strategies taking Corey Lewandowski’s position.
Avenue Strategies were working for Ukrainian opposition leader Yulia Tymoshenko.
COREY LEWANDOWSKI
He was Trump’s campaign manager early on.
He started Avenue Strategies lobbying firm which he peddled access to Trump through.
Represented Citgo (Venezuelan petroleum giant PDVSA have a 49.9% stake. PDVSA took out a loan with Rosneft with their stake in Citgo used as collateral.
He advised PDVSA to contribute $0.5m to Trump’s Inauguration to help get sanctions lifted on Venezuela, which happened.
He quit his position after he brought bad light on the firm and Birnbaum is his ‘under the radar’ replacement at Avenue Strategies
RONN TOROSSIAN
Writes Likud propaganda op-eds with George Birnbaum that attack enemies of Likud like J Street and NIF.
The op-eds are published on David Horowitz’s FrontPage Magand http://JewishPress.com
His PR Firm 5WPR is reported to have business dealings with shady Jewish and Russian oligarchs
In a op-ed for Bulldog Reporter, a PR news site, he ‘saluted Ketchum for their brilliant placing’ of a ‘article by Putin in New York Times.’
He has also claimed that ‘Putin is a genius’ and ‘King of media’Russia and Israel linked Trump associate Felix Sater is one of his clients.
Other clients include Eric Trump, Michael Flynn and Turkey’s government.
Has been pictured with pro-Trump alternative media shills of this network including Laura Loomer.

Letter/Email below from Ezra Levant - #RebelNews

This is personal to me.

Throughout history, Righteous Gentiles helped save Jews from terrible harm — including hiding Jews from Nazis during the Holocaust.

But now it’s Christians who are being persecuted. Even in Canada.

Christian pastors in Canada are being arrested, prosecuted and jailed. First it was for keeping their churches open during the pandemic. Now it’s for peacefully protesting against "drag queen story hour”.

But no-one seems to care.

I care. I care because it’s wrong. Canada is supposed to protect freedom of religion

But I also care because I feel within me a debt to Righteous Gentiles who protected Jews throughout the ages.

Do I not have a moral obligation to return the favour, to do my part to speak out for Christians who are under attack?

Over the years Rebel News has reported on these cases, when the mainstream media either ignored the stories or cheered on the persecution of these Christians. We’ve even crowdfunded lawyers to defend pastors.

But it’s getting worse.

So I have an idea. It’s a big idea, so I need your help.

I want to make a movie-quality documentary movie about the plight of Christians in Canada. Something so polished and professional that it could actually be shown on Netflix or Amazon Prime.

But to do that, I need your help.

Here, take a look at this video, where I explain my plan:

https://youtu.be/BcjnQEPQpZM

This documentary is one of the most important projects we've ever produced.

We’ve already got a working title for it: Church Under Fire: Canada's War on Christianity.

You know, the whole world thinks of Canada as a cold but friendly place where nothing much ever happens. We’ve got to wake up the world to what’s happening to Canadian Christians — not just to get help for them but to send a warning of what could happen in other countries, too.

We want to pull out all the stops to make this documentary and share it with the world. It’s got to be beautifully produced and edited, and properly marketed.

But that costs money, and we’re just a small operation. We need to raise $100,000 to cover production costs, equipment, salaries for the crew and other expenses. $100,000 sounds like a lot. But many hands make light work — we’re going to crowdfund it.

And that’s why I’m writing to you today: can you please help chip in a few dollars?

And if you help us, we’ll give you some great perks, too, ranging from limited-edition t-shirts, to a special sneak-preview viewing, to having your name on screen in the credits as an executive producer!

Those perks are just for fun: the main thing is that we raise the funds to make this movie. Can you please help?

Click here or visit our special crowdfunding website at http://www.SaveTheChristians.com. We have listed all the donation tiers and related perks directly on that site.

This is such an important project. And as the ancient Jewish scholar Hillel said, "If not you, then who? If not now, when?”

Now is the time for us all to come to the aid of Christians who are being arrested, prosecuted, jailed and humiliated in Canada of all places. If you can help us, please click here now.

And I’ll keep you posted on how the documentary progresses — and I’ll give you plenty of notice for our world premiere, too!

Eric, can we count on your support?

Yours truly,

Ezra Levant

P.S. This documentary needs to be made and it needs to be made right. That's why we need to raise a proper budget to do a beautiful job of it. Please click here or visit http://www.SaveTheChristians.com.

Thanks again for your help.

_source.contentraw:
マンハッタン検事ブラッグがトランプのDNAを欲しがる
マイケル・バクスター著 -2023年4月1日
https://realrawnews.com/2023/04/manhattan-d-a-bragg-wants-trumps-dna/

ドナルド・J・トランプ大統領が火曜日に当局に自首した場合、洗脳されたアダルト女優に口止め料を支払ったという濡れ衣を着せられた人物というより、殺人容疑者にふさわしいDNA収集プロセスを受けるかもしれないと、Eric M. Smith将軍の事務所の関係者はReal Raw Newsに語った。

彼によると、将軍の事務所は米陸軍サイバー軍（ARCYBER、）を通じて、マンハッタン検事局裁判部長のリサ・デルピッツォ（Lisa DelPizzo）からアルビン・ブラッグに送られたメールを入手し、そこには、火曜日の午後、事務所がトランプ大統領から頬の綿棒、血液、「少なくとも100本の毛髪サンプル」を採取するかどうかを尋ねているという。また、シークレットサービスがDNA採取を阻止しようとするかどうかについてのブラッグの考えも聞いています。

ARCYBERの情報筋によると、返信を傍受しなかったが、DelPizzoのメールをスミス将軍に転送した。ブラッグが架空とはいえ、追加の罪でトランプを陥れるかもしれないという予兆のように思えたからだ。

殺人事件や性的暴行事件では、法執行機関は日常的に容疑者を口移しして毛根を採取している。ほとんどの場合、容疑者（あるいは目撃者）は自発的にDNAを提出するよう求められるが、拒否すれば必然的に警察が敵対し、必要であれば力ずくで協力を強制する令状が出る。具体的な飲酒運転の捜査では、警察は酩酊物質の有無を調べるために採血の令状を取ることができます。

しかし、金融犯罪で起訴された人のDNA証拠収集を義務付ける判例はないと、憲法学財団のビル・カレン弁護士はリアル・ロー・ニュースに語った。

「大統領を起訴する判例がないだけでなく、金融犯罪の容疑者から綿棒や毛根を採取する判例も、私の知る限りではありません。もちろん、警察が尋ねることはできるが、誰も自発的に話したり助けたりすることはないはずだ。アルビン・ブラッグの起訴状はまだ封印されているが、これは疑わしいと思うし、トランプに対する告発が偽りであったとしても驚かない」とカレン氏は言う。

スミス将軍の関係者は、ブラッグがトランプのDNAを欲しがる理由をこう推測している。

"ディープステート "であるブラッグが、拘束しているトランプがクローンやドッペルゲンガー、ボディダブルではなく、本物のドナルド・トランプであることを確認したい、という可能性はなくはないでしょう。DNAがクローンを除外することはできないが、ダブルを検出することはできるだろう」と述べた。"あるいは、もちろん、彼がそこに入ったら、何か別のことで彼をハメようとするかもしれない"。

本物のトランプ大統領はNORADやAREA51に隠されていて、ドッペルゲンガーがマー・ア・ラゴに住み、集会で公の場に姿を現しているという説について、私たちは情報筋にコメントを求めた。

「もしそれが本当なら、私が言える範囲外だろう」と彼は言った。

それにもかかわらず、スミス将軍はデルピッツォのメールをトランプ大統領とその弁護団に転送したと彼は言った。

昨日お伝えしたように、スミス将軍はトランプ大統領に、マー・ア・ラゴで待機し、ニューヨークへの出張を避けるよう懇願したが、トランプ大統領はその忠告を聞き入れようとしなかった。彼らは日曜日に再び話す予定であると、我々の情報筋は述べている。
